Source code for vpipe.steps.dataprep.evaluator_loader

import logging

from vbrainer.pipeline.abstract_vbrain_step import AbstractVBrainStep
from vbrainer.pipeline.model_objects.ml_model_object import MLModelObject
from vbrainer.pipeline.steps.simple_ml_data_processor import SimpleMLDataProcessor
from vflow import VFlow

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)



[docs]class DataProcessor(AbstractVBrainStep):
    """
    Load a model already trained and apply a transform with it. For this it uses the vflow client.

    :model_name (str):
        The name of the model trained that will be loaded (mandatory)
    :model_version (int):
        The version of the model trained that will be loaded (mandatory)

    .. code-block:: python
    
        {
            "id": "d02",
            "enabled": true,
            "step_name": "DataFilter",
            "params": {
                "data_filters": {
                    "model_name": "x",
                    "model_version": 1
                }
            }
        }
    """

    def transform(self, mo: MLModelObject):
        logger.info("Starting evaluator loader")

        vflow_client: VFlow = mo.get_model()
        model_name = self.get_exec_param('model_name')
        model_version = self.get_exec_param('model_version')

        model = vflow_client.load_model(model_name, model_version)
        model.transform(mo)
        return mo
